ARABIC: وَمَن نُّعَمِّرْهُ نُنَكِّسْهُ فِى ٱلْخَلْقِ أَفَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When We grant long life to people, We return them to their primal state. So will you not use your intellect?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Whoever reaches old age, We reverse in natural disposition. Do they not have sense (to see)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Whomsoever We grant a long life, We reverse him in his constitution. Do they still not understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The physical growth of those whom We grant a long life will be reversed. Will you then not understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And whomever We bring to an old age, We reverse him in creation; so do they not understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And he whom We grant long life -- We reverse him in creation. Will they not then understand
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And whomsoever We cause to live long, We reduce (him) to an abject state in constitution; do they not then understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And to whomsoever We give long life, We bend him over in His constitution; what, do they not understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He whom we bring unto old age, We reverse him in creation (making him go back to weakness after strength). Have ye then no sense?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If We extend anyone's life, We reverse his development. Can they not use their reason?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And whomsoever We grant long life, We reverse him in creation. Reflect then they not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And whomever We give a long life, We cause him to regress in creation. Then, will they not exercise their reason?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If We grant long life to any, We cause him to be reversed in nature: Will they not then understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And he whom We grant long life, We reverse him in creation (weakness after strength). Will they not then understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: To whoever We give a long life We make him stoop. Do they not understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Whomever We grant old age, We reverse his development. Do they not understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation; so will they not understand?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:68] And whomever We give long life, by prolonging his term [of life], We cause him to regress (nankushu; a variant reading has [2nd verbal form] nunakkishu, derived from al-tankīs) in creation, that is, in terms of his physical form, so that after having enjoyed strength and youth, he becomes feeble and decrepit. Will they then not understand?, that One Who is able to effect such [a state] — with which they are familiar — is also able to resurrect, that they might then become believers? (a variant reading [for ya‘qilūna, ‘they understand’] has [the second person plural] ta‘qilūna, ‘you understand’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He whom We bring unto old age, We reverse him in creation (making him go back to weakness after strength)) until he becomes like a little child, possessing no teeth or power, he urinates and defecates on himself like a young child. (Have ye then no sense) do you then not believe in this?
